intro: Scorzonera schweinfurthii, commonly known as the Sierra Nevada globemallow, is a flowering plant native to the western United States. It belongs to the family Malvaceae and is characterized by its hairy, upright stems and showy yellow flowers. The plant produces capsule fruits that contain numerous small, round seeds. It typically grows in dry, rocky habitats and is adapted to arid environments. Scorzonera schweinfurthii is valued for its ornamental appeal and ecological importance in supporting local wildlife.
